column5: Well lets see.  I just did some playing around on the dodge site.  Im not impressed with the price for a basic 2x4 - 6 cyl.  This is the truck I want,if I get one. Single cab,short box. 4x4 would be ok.  Thats the net price before the rest of the Bull taxes.  http://www.ramtrucks.com/hostc/bmo/CUT201413DS1L61B/2TB/summary.do Come see me in September Brian when I start working at Orangeville Chyrsler!!

I guess it is in the eye of the beholder. I average 13.5 with my 13 sierra with the same motor and 3.42 rear end. It is still way better than my Old f150 was.  And Brian, if you don't think you need her permission, she is doing a better job than you think...

Brian, I'd love to share the RAM nightmare I had with Barrie Chrysler LOL. I loved my Ram Mega Cab until this year , when detailing it in the spring I discovered fist sized rotten spots on both Rockers, rust starting to show on the rear wheel wells , and front end suspension repairs that were endless. Truck had 130000 km and was NEVER worked yet basically fell apart at 125000km. Truck was bought and Dealer maintained at Barrie Chrysler and I'm still waiting to hear back from a. Chrysler manager in regards to providing me with information on how a 60000$ truck that's six years old can rot so quickly, I was supposed to hear back 2 months ago LOL, gotta say I really love my 2014 Nissan Titan Pro 4x !!!!!! I could rant for hours about this LOL .

well that's centennial / Barrie Chrysler  I couldn't even get them to show me a truck I wanted to buy ...they just were not interested so I drove to another dealer and bought one...might be the worst of the worst

I imagine I'll be around there after the lift and tires are installed.  I'm going to look into picking up a tuner as well.  Ryan, those Pro 4x Titans are awesome.  I was considering one but decided I didn't want to give up the long bed/ext cab which I dont think nissan even makes

Same experience at Barrie Chrysler.  Sales guys argued with me on every option I wanted.  Then told me the Diesel was not available in Canada - which then changed to it was going to be limited numbers.  When I told him that 8000 had already been ordered/built (this was back in march), he kinda just stammered some other pointless ideas.  I had sent them 3 build sheets - with exactly what I wanted.  They would not give me a quote unless I signed something - what I have no idea.  At any rate, I gave them a chance, but bought somewhere else.  I am all for supporting local business too - > but the local business has to be worth supporting.  Got the truck I wanted for almost 20K off the sticker.  So  - if you are looking, do your research, get your prices and shop around.  Unfortunately just not in Barrie.  (To be fair I have had the same experience at every dealer I have been too in Barrie - that's why my last 4 vehicles were purchased elsewhere).

Just get an AWD van. Covers all the bases. We brought in 2 field dressed bucks to the butcher in my dad's Caravan with a tarp down. I didn't want blood in the back of my F150! lol j/k Our next vehicle will be a van to replace my '96 Civic hatchback. Not too practical with 2 kids and 2 dogs lol
Come see me in September Brian when I start working at Orangeville Chyrsler!!  Will keep you in mind if and when I decide. Im always looking for that 30% OFC discount.

whatever truck you decide on 2014's are getting blown out the door some real good incentives on leftover trucks and vans and suvs. though if its space you want the dodge promaster with the 4 cyl 3.0l ecodeisel would give you enough storage to make a mobile outdoors store
Will keep you in mind if and when I decide. Im always looking for that 30% OFC discount. 30% is that all you need....done deal!!!
Get a high mileage Outback, put some BFG AT's on it, a lift kit and you'll be set.
30% is that all you need....done deal!!!  Off employees price of course..LMAO

As much as I  would love one,I would cringe at the fact of watching the gas pump going up to 100+ bills to fill. Yes there are many bonus factors to having a truck,but I get along just fine as you all have seen.  I have no boat to tow or a place to keep it. But I have a float aboat that fits in nice,along with anything I need for a days fishing.  This is why I have the, Mopar buddy..Great millage 60 bux to fill (when fuel is $1;30) and lasts a full two weeks.  I get to fish from Barrie to any lake near Gravenhurst..  No this is not a garage sale,this is my traveling tackle box.  Some days,I just get in and drive and I never know where or what,Im going to be fishing for. It,s an awesome feeling..      Repacked  for another outing.  No Terry,that is not your flipper.    And just so were all clear here,I dont leave my keys in it. And it is well insured.. LOL
You need the new dodge diesel 1/2 ton buddy! Same mileage as your car, with 4wd and towing is a breeze!  Nice set up though!  Where you gonna put the decoys? LOL  S.

You need the new dodge diesel 1/2 ton buddy! Same mileage as your car, with 4wd and towing is a breeze!  Nice set up though!  Where you gonna put the decoys? LOL  S.   Shane,SHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH (Im looking,just dont tell her)  Decoys are on my lap. Surprised? LOL
Not in the least! LOL  S.
A hunter does,what he has ta..LOL

or a small closed box trailer. You can buy a lot of toys for the difference between your current wheels and that beast in your sights ( although it sure would be nice, and then you would have the power to pull a nice 16 or 18 footer with the truck. Just sayin'........ )

Ok,now your pushing my luck Rick.LOL  Im happy with what I got. Some may not know the feeling I get from this simple way,but it,s a blast. Wish I had of discovered it sooner.  I still like my time out on the big boats. Don,t get me wrong.

We have a full size pickup.  With the price of gas, I try to use my 4 cylinder SUV as much as possible.  Thankfully my boat isn't huge.  I only hunt with silhouettes for geese, and I can even fit 6-8 dozen silhouettes and 2 layout blinds in my SUV.  Having the truck is nice, but it sucks paying the gas bill!
get a 2014 f150 6cyl ecoboost, a friend of mine travelled 1300 km to quebec  fully loaded with 4 guys plus towing a trailer of hunting gear on a single tank
Brian, love the tube feeling, I get you, but forget the truck and just fish (or come fishing). But yeah.. Ecoboost is real nice.....
Float, You're friend is blowing smoke up your ###.
ecoboost has lots of power but it sucks gas like it was 20cents a liter many v8s get better mileage

I was going to stay away from this as everyone has a diff opinion when it comes to vehicles  Anyway....this is what I ended up doing  My 4 door f150 is gone---it was a great truck but as everyone knows----at $1.30---your looking at $170 to fill from empty  I had 3 criteria on my search....4wd...tow a boat....good gas mileage  Now I had a truck but I ran around with the box empty 363 days of the year  Many small suv's don't have the tow capacity but can get the other 2 criteria  So This is what I got-----ford escape---2 litre eco-boost---3500 lb towing capacity---4wd------great on gas  I have a utility trailer if I need a dump/lumber yard run (smartest thing I ever bought)  An Ottawa run would cost me 100 dollars round trip------now just did one for 40
I did a trip to New Brunswick beginning of august, we had a 2013 eco boost that also did the trip in one tank, it was 1500km to the destination, but as mentioned above its a hefty fill up

Well lets see.  I just did some playing around on the dodge site.  Im not impressed with the price for a basic 2x4 - 6 cyl.  This is the truck I want,if I get one. Single cab,short box. 4x4 would be ok.  Thats the net price before the rest of the Bull taxes.  http://www.ramtrucks.com/hostc/bmo/CUT201413DS1L61B/2TB/summary.do
Single cab?  Don't do that man, lol.   Extended cab at a minimum.
You can get the quad cab for that price http://www.ramtruck.ca/en/offers/ontario/1500/?
More room for more crap.LOL
Hold up!!  The wife SAYS you need a new truck? That is half of the battle my friend. If you aren't ready to step up to that, keep in your back pocket for future use!  Adam

Hold up!!  The wife SAYS you need a new truck? That is half of the battle my friend. If you aren't ready to step up to that, keep in your back pocket for future use!  Adam   I don,t need her permission .

Another avenue to check would be a wagon, I had one, excellent storage capacity and I now as of last week picked up a 2011 tucson, 2.4l 4 cyl rated for 2000lbs towing, should be good for my uses in the coming years and it's got a ton of interior space with a great ride
My parents used to have a K-Car wagon. Those were awesome for carrying lots of stuff and it was a great sleep wagon. It was the woody style.

Don't get a GMC/Chev if it's mileage you're after.  My '13 5.3 is an awesome truck, but they still haven't figured out how to make their v8's reasonably efficient.  My current rolling avg. according to the DIC is 15.1 MPG...oww!!

When I was 17,I drove an old 78 Renault wagon. Bought it for 700 buxs certified. Pukey green color  I could care the less though. I could throw all my gear in it and head to the Sound. Was a great feeling at the age of 17.

Don't get a GMC/Chev if it's mileage you're after. My '13 5.3 is an awesome truck, but they still haven't figured out how to make their v8's reasonably efficient. My current rolling avg. according to the DIC is 15.1 MPG...oww!!   Never been a GMC guy..  But I do love the look of the Camero.
